title.narrative: Mechanism 14647 - Construction of Rural Health Centers - 5 in Zambezia

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
The Type II Rural Health Center (II RHC) Construction mechanism encompasses the following activities: Maternity building, outpatient building, a house for pregnant mothers, staff housing, water supply installation, solar energy installation and health facilities equipment. Each of the above activities had its own mechanism. USAID decided to combine the construction activities into a single mechani Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

The Type II Rural Health Center (II RHC) Construction mechanism encompasses the following activities: Maternity building, outpatient building, a house for pregnant mothers, staff housing, water supply installation, solar energy installation and health facilities equipment. Each of the above activities had its own mechanism. USAID decided to combine the construction activities into a single mechanism; Type II Rural Health Center Construction mechanism, and the respective funding were combined into this mechanism. Two contracts were awarded in December 2013 to build 16 Type II RHC. The combination reduces the management units and the number of solicitations to be issued (6 to 1) and does not change the objectives and the targets of the mechanisms.
The object of this mechanism is to achieve carefully targeted of the Health Service Infrastructure which: 1) provide an essential enabling environment for PEPFAR partners’ core activities, hence contributing to the Partnership Framework objective 3.5, and 2) fit well with MISAU plans and policy of improving access to quality health services. The specific project goal is to build 11 Type II Rural Health Centers in Tete (6 II RHC) and Nampula (5 II RHC ) provinces.
The implementation of this mechanism, will increasing the number of service delivery points, this activity also inputs to strengthening the Mozambican health system, and leverages MoH and other donors’ efforts to improve improving access to health care. Combined Reference HQ Mechanisms ID are: Type II Rural Health Center construction (14647), staff housing construction (14646), water supply installation (14648), solar energy installation (14645) and health facilities equipment (14643) and DPS Rehabilitations of Health Facilities (14641).

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 2100 Pennsylvania Avenue, Suite 200, Washington, DC 20522, USA

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
